column4: ^2MacTavish: ^7We've got one good UMP.  They've got a thousand.
^2MacTavish: ^7We don't even know if Makarov's intel's any good.
^2MacTavish: ^7Price.
^2MacTavish: ^7...Price?
^2Price: ^7The healthy human mind doesn't wake up in the morning thinking this is its last day on Earth.
^2Price: ^7But I think that's a luxury.  Not a curse.
^2Price: ^7To know you're close to the end is a kind of freedom.
^2Price: ^7Good time to take... inventory.
^2Price: ^7Outgunned.  Outnumbered.  Out of our minds. On a suicide mission.
^2Price: ^7But the sand and rocks here, stained with thousands of years of warfare...
^2Price: ^7They will remember us.  For this.
^2Price: ^7Because out of all our vast array of nightmares, this is the one we choose for ourselves.
^2Price: ^7We go forward like a breath exhaled from the Earth.
^2Price: ^7With vigor in our hearts and one goal in sight:
^2Price: ^7We.  Will.
^2Price: ^7Kill him.
^2Price: ^7This is for the record.
^2Price: ^7History is written by the victor.
^2Price: ^7History is filled with liars.
^2Price: ^7If he lives and we die, his truth becomes written -
^2Price: ^7- and ours is lost.
^2Price: ^7Shepherd will be a hero.  'Cause all you need to change the world is one good lie and a river of blood.
^2Price: ^7He's about to complete the greatest trick a liar ever played on history.
^2Price: ^7His truth will be the truth.
^2Price: ^7But only if he lives, and we die.
^2Shepherd: ^7The rest of Task Force 141 brought in the ACS, Allen.
^2Shepherd: ^7Two men took down an entire base.  I ask much more from you now.
^2Shepherd: ^7Yesterday you were a soldier on the front lines.  But today front lines are history.
^2Shepherd: ^7Uniforms are relics.  The war rages everywhere.  And there will be casualties.
^2Shepherd: ^7This man Makarov is fighting his own war and he has no rules.  No boundaries.
^2Shepherd: ^7He doesn't flinch at torture, human trafficking, or genocide.
^2Shepherd: ^7He's not loyal to a flag or a country or any set of ideals.  He trades blood for money.
^2Shepherd: ^7He's your new best friend.
^2Shepherd: ^7You don't want to know what it's cost already to put you next to him.
^2Shepherd: ^7It will cost you a piece of yourself.
^2Shepherd: ^7It will cost nothing compared to everything you'll save.
^2Shepherd: ^7Someone turn off that damn TV.
^2Shepherd: ^7My Task Force is out of the country.  I'm commandeering your unit, Sergeant Foley.
^2Sgt. Foley: ^7Yes, Sir.  All yours, Sir.
^2Shepherd: ^7I've requisitioned a Stryker from the Eighth Armored.
^2Sgt. Foley: ^7Honey Badger's a mean bitch, Sir.
^2Shepherd: ^7She'll walk you in.  The Russians are burning through our defenses and our intel.
^2Shepherd: ^7Can't let 'em take this corner.
^2Sgt. Foley: ^7Just point it out on the map, Sir. They won't take it.
^2MacTavish: ^7Roach? Ghost? Come in, Ghost! Do you copy?  Does anyone copy?
^2Price: ^7They're dead, Soap.  Shepherd's cleaning house.  I'm working my way back to you.
^2MacTavish: ^7Shepherd betrayed us.
^2Price: ^7Have to trust someone to be betrayed.  I never did.
^2Price: ^7Nikolai, come in.  Do you have our location?
^2Nikolai: ^7Da.  Inbound, Price.  But I am not the only one.
^2Nikolai: ^7You've got Shepherd's men on one side, Makarov's on the other.
^2Price: ^7We'll have to take them all out then.
^2Nikolai: ^7Or let them take each other out.
^2Nikolai: ^7Either way, I'll see you on the other side my friend.
^2PFC Allen: ^7So how do I look?
^2Shepherd: ^7Like one of the bad guys.
^2Shepherd: ^7Perfect for your undercover assignment.
^2PFC Allen: ^7So Makarov is the prize.
^2Shepherd: ^7Makarov's no prize. He's a whore. A mad-dog killer for the highest bidder.
^2Shepherd: ^7Just remember your new identity. It'll keep you alive.
^2Shepherd: ^7Welcome to the 141.  Best handpicked group of warriors on the planet.
^2PFC Allen: ^7It's an honor, Sir. When do I meet the rest of the team?
^2Shepherd: ^7They're on a mission recovering a downed ACS module behind enemy lines.
^2PFC Allen: ^7Their feet wet?
^2Shepherd: ^7Imagine they're just about freezing right now.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Uplink nearly complete.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7General Shepherd you're online with Captain Price.
^2Shepherd: ^7Back from the brink, Captain.
^2Captain Price: ^7'Out of the frying pan' is more like it.
^2Captain Price: ^7This world looks more like hell than the one I just left.
^2Shepherd: ^7We thought we'd recovered the ACS before the Russians could crack it.
^2Shepherd: ^7We were wrong.
^2Shepherd: ^7Then Makarov turned the U.S. into his scapegoat.  Next thing you know there's flames everywhere.
^2Shepherd: ^7What's this image you're sending me?
^2Captain Price: ^7You wanna put out an oil fire, Sir, you set off a bigger explosion right next to it.
^2Captain Price: ^7Sucks away the oxygen.  Snuffs the flame.
^2Shepherd: ^7Price, you been locked away too long. Better get your mind right, son.
^2Captain Price: ^7Shepherd, are you willing to do what is necessary to win?
^2Shepherd: ^7Always.
^2Captain Price: ^7We got ourselves a pretty big fire. Gonna need a huge bang.
^2Shepherd: ^7You've been in the Gulag too long, Price.  Focus on taking out Makarov.
^2Captain Price: ^7No time, Sir.  We need to end this war today.
^2Shepherd: ^7I'm not asking you, Price.  This is an order!  You're to...
^2Captain Price: ^7Looks like we lost our connection.
^2 ^7PRINCE GEORGE'S COUNTY RESIDENTS ARE INSTRUCTED TO GO DIRECTLY TO THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT AT 147 KIRKWOOD AVE.
^2 ^7PICK-UPS EVERY 15 MINUTES FROM COMMUNITY COLLEGE CAMPUS IN UNIVERSITY TOWN. /// EMERGENCY EVACUATION IN PROGRESS. ///
^2 ^7HEAD IMMEDIATELY TO YOUR NEAREST SERVICE SHELTER. TROOPS WILL BE THERE TO MEET YOU.
^2 ^7BRING A PHOTO ID AND NO MORE THAN ONE BAGGAGE ITEM PER PERSON. /// BE AWARE OF YOUR SURROUNDINGS. REMAIN ALERT.
^2SecDef: ^7Gentlemen, the missile's vector puts it en route to the East Coast.  We will lose the White House.
^2Shepherd: ^7We've rebuilt it before, we'll rebuild it again.
^2SecDef: ^7Casualties?
^2Shepherd: ^7Possibly 30,000 to 50,000.  Depends on the exact location of the detonation.  All systems will go down.
^2SecDef: ^7General Shepherd, you warned us. We should've listened.
^2Shepherd: ^7When they speak of this moment, we will not be the ones who stood guard while America died.
^2Shepherd: ^7One man is responsible for all this. Makarov must be brought to light.
^2SecDef: ^7Whatever you need, General.  You've got a blank check.
^2Shepherd: ^7It's been a tough week, gentlemen. We've lost more than we ever dreamed.  But we will recover.
\n^2Shepherd: ^7I've got a blank check.  And we're gonna use every cent of it killin' Makarov.
^2Shepherd: ^7Despite what the world may say, we are not savages, we don't kill civilians. We use precision.
^2Shepherd: ^7There's an evil man hiding in these shadows and we're gonna bring him into the light.
^2Shepherd: ^7Once his face is revealed, we will write history, gentlemen.
^2Shepherd: ^7These are the last safe havens left on Earth for Makarov and his men.
^2Captain Price: ^7Sounds like we gotta be in two places at once.
^2Shepherd: ^7Impossible?
^2Captain Price: ^7Not for the One-Four-One.
^2Ghost: ^7Fifty-fifty chance to take out Makarov, eh?
^2Ghost: ^7Captain Price, request permission to take the safehouse with Roach.
^2Captain Price: ^7Granted. Soap and I will take the boneyard in Afghanistan.
^2Shepherd: ^7Very well. We will cut off all avenues of escape.  This ends now.
^2Captain Price: ^7Strange.  I coulda sworn we ended this war yesterday.
^2Ghost: ^7I can't get anyone on the horn.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7The Russians must've copied the ACS module. Got the key to every lock in America.
^2Ghost: ^7And they're killing a thousand Americans for every dead civilian in Moscow.  Looks like we're all outta friends.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7I know a guy.  Let's find a payphone,  if they still exist.
^2Ghost: ^7All we got outta Rojas is that the only guy Makarov hates worse than Americans is locked up in a Gulag.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7It's all we got.  If this con's the bait to catch that psychopath, let's hang him from a tree.
\n^2Ghost: ^7The Russians ain't gonna let this massacre go unanswered. It's gonna get bloody.
\n^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Too right, mate. Now, in the eyes of the world, they're the victims.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7No one's gonna say a word when the Russians club every American they can reach.
^2Shepherd: ^7Makarov was one move ahead.  Now he's left thousands of bodies at the feet of an American.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7We're the only ones who know it was Makarov's op.  Our credibility died with Allen.  We need proof.
^2Shepherd: ^7Follow the shell.
^2Shepherd: ^7Alejandro Rojas.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Never heard of him, Sir.
^2Shepherd: ^7You know him as Alex the Red.  He supplied the assault.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7One bullet to unleash the fury of a whole nation.  Which means...
^2Shepherd: ^7He's our ticket to Makarov.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Sixth Fleet's mopping up.  Time to move in.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Long history, this building.  Not much of it pretty.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Started out as a castle.  With an actual dungeon.  Built to withstand any siege.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Building survived every brutal winter.  The occupants... they weren't so lucky.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7The Monastery.  Didn't survive the Purges.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Over the last century it's played host to anyone the government didn't want, but couldn't kill.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Place is filled with living casualties of the last war... which I swear I thought we'd won.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7But I suppose it's all a day at the races: you back the losing horse, and this is where you end up.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Six-Two-Seven is the piece of meat Makarov wants, so let's cut him loose.
^2SAS: ^7It's the F.N.G. sir.
^2Captain Price: ^7What the hell kind of name is Soap?
^1Al-Asad: ^7Warfare is the way of deception.
^2Captain Price: ^7Nikolai's in hell right now. We're gonna walk him outâ€¦
^2Captain Price: ^7We take care of our friends.
^2Captain Price: ^7Zakhaev. Imran Zakhaev.
^1Zakhaev: ^7My son's blood on their hands.
^2Captain Price: ^7Delta One X-Ray, we have a missile launch, I repeat we have a missile...
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Sand Bravo, we're reading 70 bogeys in your sector, please verify.
^2Nome AFB: ^7Very funny, Station.  That's a big negative, over.
^2NORAD Controller: ^7Yeah, might be a glitch in one of the ACS modules.
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Sand Bravo, be advised, running diagnostics to scan for malfunction.
^2Nome AFB: ^7The skies are clear, Station.  You got yourself some phantom dots.  Over.
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Zulu X-Ray 6.  Signs in your sector of some 100 bogeys, please advise.
^2Vandenberg AFB: ^7Negatory, Station.  Scope is clear. I dunno what to tell ya.  Solar interference?  Heavy sunspot activity today.
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Sierra Delta, uh... we may have a minor ACS fault here. Do you have anything on your scope?
^2Air Traffic Controller: ^7They're everywhere!
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Sierra Delta, repeat!
^2Air Traffic Controller: ^7I'm lookin' at fighter jets over I-95!  How the hell did they get through?
^2NORAD HQ: ^7Standby!  Attempting to contact the nearest unit in that sector.
^2Sgt. Foley: ^7I read you.  This is First Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment, Sergeant Foley, acting commander of Hunter Two-One. Do you copy over?
^2NORAD HQ: ^7All stations, be advised - satellite surveillance has been disabled. SOSUS and Pave Paws arrays are inoperative at this time.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Seems we're headed the wrong direction, Sir.  Shouldn't we be coming back to the fight?
^2Shepherd: ^7Plenty of fight to go around, MacTavish.
^2Shepherd: ^7Glad you made it outta South America.  You're meeting up with the 6th Fleet.  Leadin' the counter-strike.
^2Shepherd: ^7Prisoner Six-Two-Seven.  We believe that's who Makarov's got the mad-on for.  But we can't get to him.
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7Oilrigs, Sir?
^2Shepherd: ^7Russians are using them as SAM sites.
^2Shepherd: ^7Oil workers are human shields, so we can't just blow up the rigs wholesale.  And this one is the least defended.
^2Shepherd: ^7Boys, I know I'm sending you into the meat grinder on this one...
^2Captain MacTavish: ^7They're defending it, so it means we want it.  Especially if it gets us to Six-Two-Seven.
^2Shepherd: ^7We are the most powerful military force in the history of man.
^2Shepherd: ^7Every fight is our fight.
^2Shepherd: ^7Because what happens over here, matters over there. We don't get to sit one out.
^2Shepherd: ^7Learning to use the tools of modern warfare is the difference between the prospering of your people, and utter destruction.
^2Shepherd: ^7We can't give you freedom.  But we can give you the know-how to acquire it.
^2Shepherd: ^7And that, my friends, is worth more than a whole army base of steel.
^2Shepherd: ^7Sure it matters who's got the biggest stick, but it matters a helluva lot more who's swinging it.
^2Shepherd: ^7This is a time for heroes.  A time for legends.
^2Shepherd: ^7History is written by the victors.
^2Shepherd: ^7Let's get to work.
^2Shepherd: ^7The more things change, the more they stay the same.
^2Shepherd: ^7Boundaries shift, new players step in, but power always finds a place to rest its head.
^2Shepherd: ^7We fought and bled alongside the Russians.  We shoulda known they'd hate us for it.
^2Shepherd: ^7History is written by the victor. And here I am, \nthinking we'd won.
^2Shepherd: ^7But you bring down one enemy and they find someone even worse to replace him.
^2Shepherd: ^7Locations change, the rationale, the objective.
^2Shepherd: ^7Yesterday's enemies are today's recruits.
^2Shepherd: ^7Train them to fight alongside you, and pray they don't eventually decide to hate you for it too.
^2Shepherd: ^7Same shit, different day.
^2Shepherd: ^7You know what I'm looking for, Sergeant Foley.  Keep your eyes open.
^2Sgt. Foley: ^7Got a new batch hittin' the pit today, Sir.  I'll send you the best I find.
